basics.name: Jeff Sikes
basics.label: Director of Application Development
basics.summary: Technology leader with 13+ years building and scaling engineering teams in mission-driven nonprofit organizations. Proven track record managing cross-functional technical operations, platform modernizations, and vendor relationships while balancing limited resources with organizational impact. Graduate of the Texas Society of Association Executives (TSAE) Leadership Program.

work.name: BOX464 Holdings, LLC
work.summary: Contracted with AANP to lead a comprehensive knowledge transfer following departure from Director role.
highlights: Created training videos and technical documentation covering all internal systems and processes
Built a Cloudflare AutoRAG MCP server containing institutional knowledge with a chat interface for staff to query

work.name: American Association of Nurse Practitioners
work.summary: Led cross-functional team of 7 staff (3 developers, 2 project managers, 1 data analyst, 1 business analyst) supporting 120,000 nurse practitioners through member services, education, conferences, and political advocacy.
highlights: Led enterprise Salesforce implementation (Unlimited Edition) - Sales, Service, Marketing, Commerce, Experience, and Data Cloud - replacing legacy Aptify AMS
Managed data migration from Aptify to Salesforce using CData DBAmp - 400,000+ contacts and nearly one million orders, plus custom object data, maintaining referential integrity throughout
Configured Chargent to work with Commerce Cloud for managing membership renewals, auto-renewals, promotions, and coupon structures
Implemented SSO integrations between Experience Cloud and multiple third-party vendors via SAML Connected Apps
Served as acting VP of IT for six months, overseeing application development and infrastructure teams (9 total staff)
Implemented Zendesk across departments, reducing support call volume through knowledge base; system ownership successfully transitioned to non-IT staff

Modernized infrastructure over 12 years - from on-premise server room to Rackspace, then Aptify Cloud, then Azure - implementing load balancing, Cloudflare proxies, and page rules for performance and security
Designed and co-developed a REST API abstraction layer allowing the organization to swap third-party vendors (conference reg, LMS, etc.) without impacting any websites or member-facing systems
Managed vendor relationships with Higher Logic, Real Magnet, InReach, Community Brands, MuleSoft, and conference providers

work.name: American Association of Nurse Practitioners
work.summary: Led technical transition from legacy systems to Aptify AMS during rapid organizational growth (35,000 to 120,000 members).
highlights: Built first in-house development team from scratch; hired and mentored developers and project managers
Managed Aptify configuration, custom objects, finance/GL integrations, and third-party connections
Developed custom applications for member portal, payments, and conference registration using .NET MVC, React, and SQL Server
Created integrations with registration and exhibitor systems for conference check-in and exhibitor scanning
Implemented international membership expansion with country-based pricing in Aptify
Established development standards, code review practices, source control workflows, and release processes
Collaborated with VP of Technology on annual budget planning and technical roadmap

work.name: American Association of Nurse Practitioners
work.summary: Database Administrator, Cloud Systems Administrator, Web Application Developer, and Technical Lead for technology integration projects. Managed and distributed workloads for internal, third-party, and contract development teams.

work.name: iHealth Technologies (ECOM PPO Advisors, LLC)
work.summary: Design and maintenance of all web applications, reporting and analysis for both web applications and claim data, mentoring of new and existing developers. Transitioned to 100% telecommute for the final 3 years.

work.name: Innovative Risk Management
work.summary: Maintained and enhanced web applications, converted Access database tools to SQL/web applications, created and managed development and testing environments and associated codebases.

work.name: Argo Data Resource Corp.
work.summary: Reviewed and updated user interfaces for web-based applications. Created UI design guidelines for developers. Built sales demonstrations with Robodemo (Captivate). Reviewed and analyzed Learning Management Systems.

work.name: Healthaxis
work.summary: Developed and maintained two prominent web applications, trained current and new developers, acted as technical lead for projects. Created a developer toolkit that greatly reduced new development completion times.

work.name: Larson Multimedia
work.summary: Client contact for all internet projects, managed contractors, developed and managed quality assurance tools, managed production teams for all internet projects. Produced prototypes and developed web applications.

work.name: Zane Interactive Publishing
work.summary: Processed source data for use in multimedia projects using Photoshop and video editing tools. Created standardized workflows and templates to increase developer efficiency. Produced over 300 educational CD-ROM titles.
